LOS 12.i
A paired comparisons test is concerned with the mean of the differences between the
paired observations of two dependent, normally distributed samples. A t-statistic,
t=º, where si
, and ā is the average difference of the n paired observations,
is used to test whether the means of two dependent normal variables are equal. Values
outside the critical t-values lead us to reject equality.
